results.title: Paris - Wikipedia
results.snippet: Paris is a global centre of finance, diplomacy, culture, and gastronomy, with an estimated population of 2 million residents in 2025. It has many famous landmarks, museums, and historical districts, and hosts several international organizations and sports events.

results.title: Paris | Definition, Map, Population, Facts, & History | Britannica
results.snippet: Paris, city and capital of France, located along the Seine River, in the north-central part of the country. Paris is one of the world's most important and attractive cities, famed for its gastronomy, haute couture, painting, literature, and intellectual community. Learn more about Paris in this article.

results.title: What is the Capital of France? - WorldAtlas
results.snippet: Learn about the history, geography, economy, tourism, and administration of Paris, the capital city of France and the country's largest city. Find out why Paris is called the City of Light and the City of Love.

results.title: Paris - Simple English Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
results.snippet: Paris is the capital city and the largest city of France, with a population of about 2.15 million. It has a rich history, many art museums, historical buildings, and a famous landmark, the Eiffel Tower.

results.title: France | History, Maps, Flag, Population, Cities, Capital, & Facts ...
results.snippet: Learn about France, a country of northwestern Europe with a rich and influential culture, history, and politics. The capital of France is Paris, one of the world's leading cities of art, science, and commerce.
